subject: Re: [junit] coverage testing
msgSnippet: Thanks Cedric, Robert for your inputs. I would take care of the downsides of Code coverage. Warm Regards, Sachin  Dholakia Cédric Beust ?
messageBody:
Thanks Cedric, Robert for your inputs. I would take care of the downsides
of Code coverage.

Warm Regards,
Sachin Dholakia





Cédric Beust ? <cbeust@...>
Sent by: junit@yahoogroups.com
11/16/2005 07:04 PM
Please respond to
junit@yahoogroups.com


To
junit@yahoogroups.com
cc

Subject
Re: [junit] coverage testing






Hi Sachin,

On 11/15/05, sachin.dholakia@... <sachin.dholakia@...> wrote:
>
> Hi J.B,
>
> I am on the other side of the shore and believe in Code coverage and so
> very interested in knowing why you feel that 100% code coverage isn't a
> requirement for code check in? Can you please share your thoughts?


Nobody disputes that 100% code coverage is a good thing, it's just that it
becomes impossibly hard to achieve as your code base becomes more complex.
You just need to make sure you don't hit the point of diminishing return
when trying to hit a balance between "more code coverage", "more tests",
"bug fixes" and "more features".

--
Cédric
http://testng.org
